thread.title: WATCH: Professional Slackliner Scales Ski Lift and Saves Man’s Life
thread.title_full: WATCH: Professional Slackliner Scales Ski Lift and Saves Man’s Life

author: tdaswick
title: WATCH: Professional Slackliner Scales Ski Lift and Saves Man’s Life
text:
Your Privacy Rights Canadian Customers 
Like hiring Liam Neeson as your daughter’s babysitter, it pays to have friends with a very particular set of skills. A group of Arapahoe Basin skiers learned that firsthand on Wednesday, when a man fell off a chairlift and caught his backpack strap on the chair, leaving him hanging by the throat for an agonizing 5 minutes. The situation looked grim until slackline champion and local ski instructor Mickey Wilson sprung into action and saved the man’s life without even breaking a sweat. Wilson recounted the harrowing rescue to The Denver Post , so here’s how it all went down. 
At about 11 a.m. on the Lenawee Mountain Lift, a man attempted to get off his chair atop the mountain but caught a snag when his backpack strap wedged into the side of the chair. He fell out of the bench, but the straps kept him attached by hanging him from the neck. The lift kept moving until the operator saw the struggling man and shut it down, and the man’s feet dangled precariously above the powder as he lost consciousness. Two close friends attempted to climb on top of each other to cut him down, but couldn’t find the footing. That’s when Wilson stepped in: Advertisement
